alert.note: Alert for Banks; Barrow; DeKalb; Forsyth; Gwinnett; Hall; Jackson; Rockdale; Walton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 21 at 3:55PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Rockdale, Barrow, east central DeKalb, east central Forsyth, Gwinnett, southwestern Banks, northwestern Walton, southern Hall and northwestern Jackson Counties through 430 PM EST ... At 355 PM EST, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Oscarville to near Suwanee to Belmont, and moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Gainesville, Lawrenceville, Winder, Jefferson, Homer, Sugar Hill, Snellville, Suwanee, Buford, Lilburn, Loganville, Braselton, Auburn, Stone Mountain, Flowery Branch, Dacula, Oakwood, Grayson, Lithonia, and Maysville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: Banks; Barrow; DeKalb; Forsyth; Gwinnett; Hall; Jackson; Rockdale; Walton
